result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric Johnson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Johnson

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Johnson in court.  Attorney Richard Henry Hart Jr. in court for Eric Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED as a matter of law.

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 3 days time served, Huber Privileges for work, treatment and care for parent (mother).
- Pay a fine of $2,400.00 inclusive of costs due in 6 MONTHS. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court ordered defendants operation privileges revoked for 24 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.
- Court ordered any vehicle owned, operated and titled in the defendant's name to be equipped with the ignition interlock device for 24 MONTHS.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge due in 6 MONTHS.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waived ALL MANDATORY and NON-MANDATORY COSTS.
- Cash bond on deposit to apply to costs.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Per 346.65(2)(g)3. If a person convicted had an alcohol concentration of 0.25 or above, the applicable minimum and maximum fines under par. (am) 3. to 5. are quadrupled.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Eric Johnson in court.  Attorney Richard Henry Hart Jr. appeared by phone for Eric Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Preliminary Motions in Limine and Pretrial Motions, received and filed

Adjustment Number: 22A 077391,
Payable Number: 1025269,
Receipt Number: 22RP032139,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant previously posted $2,600. Court orders $500 remain on deposit and that the rest is returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eric Johnson in court with attorney . Gregg Herman along with student intern Josh Rather, under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge , Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@1:30pm
